item.title: Four dead in horror crash
item.description: Four people have died in a ‘tragic’ accident on a notorious Gold Coast hinterland road.

item.title: Vic virus: Where the new cases are
item.description: Victoria recorded 357 cases of COVID-19 on Saturday with five deaths as the second wave of the pandemic continues in the state.

item.title: Aged care outbreaks the ‘absolute priority’
item.description: A partnership between the Victorian and federal governments will ensure additional support in the wake of Victoria’s coronavirus outbreaks in aged care centres.

item.title: Cops enforce no-standing rule at nightclubs
item.description: Police will randomly inspect pubs, clubs and bars across Queensland on Saturday night as venues readjust to the latest round of coronavirus restrictions.

item.title: 100 virus busters caught at bush party
item.description: Up to 100 people partying in front of a DJ in a national park near Thredbo, in the NSW ski fields, have been busted by police with a significant number detained and fined for breaching COVID-19 health orders.

item.title: Coronavirus linked to sharp DV spike
item.description: The coronavirus pandemic created a “perfect storm” which has seen a shocking increase in the rate of domestic and family violence in Queensland.

item.title: Drug bust at COVID checkpoint
item.description: A COVID-19 checkpoint in outer Melbourne led to a bust of a ‘large quantity’ of illegal drugs.

item.title: Sausages are sizzling again
item.description: The tantalising smell of onions cooking on a Saturday morning has returned to Bunnings Warehouse stores in most parts of the country, as 200 keen community groups cook up a new-look sausage sizzle.

item.title: Horror night: three dead after crashing into trees
item.description: Three men died in two separate crashes where their cars smashed into trees on Victorian roads overnight on Friday.

item.title: Man wanted for music festival assault
item.description: A digital image of a man suspected of sexually assaulting a woman at a music festival at Lorne in Victoria in 2018 has been released.
